questions.question_text: Which activity can be used to iterate through data tables?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
For each row cand iterate through each row in a data table !

Variables are used to store data that can change during the execution of a workflow. They are used to hold data temporarily and can be manipulated throughout the workflow.Arguments are similar to variables but are used to pass data between workflows or between different parts of a workflow. They allow you to provide input to workflows and receive output from them.

Selected Answer: C
Variables are for the same workflow file. Arguments are between different workflows

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer !

questions.question_text: What is used to pass data between activites inside workflows?

discussion.content: C is the correct answer. As long as it is other than '0' , negative or positive value will go thru True

questions.question_text:
While performing a code review, it was discovered that a developer failed to use best practices and wrote the following expression in the Condition Field of an If actvity:
Convert.ToBoolean(ExampleInteger) = False
What is the result of the expression referenced above if “ExampleInteger” = 0 and how should the expression in the Condition Field be written based on best practices?

choices.D:
Expression Result: False -
Condition: Convert.ToBoolean(ExampleInteger) = True
choices.B:
Expression Result: True -
Condition: Convert.ToBoolean(ExampleInteger) = True

discussion.content: The default value on the variable "Fruits" is "Apple" in the Main.xaml file. We are looking for the output in the Write Line activity so I believe the answer is "Apple"

The answer is ", Orange" because the direction of the argument is "out"
If the direction is "in" the answer is "apple"
If the direction is "in/out" the answer is "apple, orange"

Selected Answer: B
B is correct answer proved in practical

Selected Answer: B
I've created the code in UIPATH and the output is ",Orange" so the answer is "B". Because it's the fruit variable that defaults to "Apple" before entering the sequence, "Apple" is automatically deleted by the output variable.

The default value of "Fruits" is "Apple", but this is never passed into the shopping basket workflow (as the argument only goes "Out"). So the Assign in the shopping basket adds ", Orange" to the empty out_Shoppingbasket argument and passes this out of the workflow. This overwrites the default value "Apple" in the existing variable "Fruits". 

Thus, the Write Line should be ", Orange".

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is ",Orange"

Selected Answer: B
Orange is answer because we are getting output from the second file.
Correct answer is ",Orange"

Selected Answer: B
", Orange" is the answer
correct answer should be "Apple"
I tested all three directions 'in, out, in/out' and the result was the same: 'Apple'

Selected Answer: B
Tested in Studio

I build this on test studio and the answer is just ,Orange (because you have a comma in the output message)>
if the argument is IN the answer is Apple, if the argument is in/out the answer is apple.orange

Correction should e Orange (B)
Actually the result appear as ,Orange as the comma is added in the called workflow
verified in studio
